com.pb.sawdust.io

Class DelimitedDataReader

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.pb.sawdust.io.DelimitedDataReader

  • @Immutable
public class DelimitedDataReader
extends java.lang.Object
    The DelimitedDataReader is used to read delimited data from a file. Delimited data is structured such that each line (or lines) holds a series of data entries, each separated by a specified delimiter. The rules for delimited text spelled out in DelimitedDataParser apply here. Additionally:
    • Unless the multiline flag has been set to true, each line in the file denotes a row of data.
    • If the multiline flag is set to true, then a quoted entry can contain one or more line termination characters, which will not be used to define a "row" of data. A row of multiline data ends when a line termination outside of a quoted entry is found.
    No other restrictions are made or assumed as far as the internal details of the data; in particular, there is no requirement that each row have the same number of entries, nor that there is a consistency of data "types" across different rows of data.

    A DelimitedDataReader instance is immutable, so it is threadsafe and may be used safely without external synchronization.

    • Constructor Detail

      • DelimitedDataReader

        public DelimitedDataReader(char delimiter,
                   boolean multilineRows)
        Constructor specifying the data delimiter and the multiline row flag.
        Parameters:
        delimiter - The data delimiter.
        multilineRows - If true, multiline rows will be allowed. Enabling multiline rows is less efficient than if it was not, so it should be enabled only if necessary.

      • DelimitedDataReader

        public DelimitedDataReader(char delimiter)
        Constructor for a non-multiline row reader specifying the data delimiter.
        Parameters:
        delimiter - The data delimiter.

    • Method Detail

      • getLineIterator

        public IterableReader<java.lang.String[]> getLineIterator(java.io.File file)
        Get a reader which iterates over the delimited data in a specified file. Each iteration cycle returns a string array which contains the parsed data from one line of the data file. When this iteration cycle is complete (i.e. hasNext() == false), the reader (file) will be closed; however, if the iterator is not used to completion, then the reader should be closed by calling the close() method.

        If the input file has an unparsable line (e.g. has unmatched quotes), then an IllegalArgumentException will be thrown when that line is reached.

        The iterator returned by this method is safe for access by concurrent threads.

        Parameters:
        file - The file to create the reader for.
        Returns:
        an iterator which cycles over the parsed delimited data from file.

      • getLineIterator

        public IterableReader<java.lang.String[]> getLineIterator(java.io.File file,
                                                 java.nio.charset.Charset charset)
        Get a reader which iterates over the delimited data in a specified file. Each iteration cycle returns a string array which contains the parsed data from one line of the data file. When this iteration cycle is complete (i.e. hasNext() == false), the reader (file) will be closed; however, if the iterator is not used to completion, then the reader should be closed by calling the close() method.

        If the input file has an unparsable line (e.g. has unmatched quotes), then an IllegalArgumentException will be thrown when that line is reached.

        The iterator returned by this method is safe for access by concurrent threads.

        Parameters:
        file - The file to create the reader for.
        charset - The character set (encoding) to use when reading the file.
        Returns:
        an iterator which cycles over the parsed delimited data from file.

      • getLineIterator

        public IterableReader<java.lang.String[]> getLineIterator(java.io.File file,
                                                 Filter<java.lang.String> lineFilter)
        Get a reader which iterates over the delimited data in a specified file and can skip lines. Each iteration cycle returns a string array which contains the parsed data from one line of the data file. When this iteration cycle is complete (i.e. hasNext() == false), the reader (file) will be closed; however, if the iterator is not used to completion, then the reader should be closed by calling the close() method.

        A line is only included if it passes the line filter. The line filter acts on the unparsed line, which allows unparsable lines (such as comments or errant data) to be processed and skipped.

        If the input file has an unparsable line (e.g. has unmatched quotes) which passes the line filter, then an IllegalArgumentException will be thrown when that line is reached.

        The iterator returned by this method is safe for access by concurrent threads.

        Parameters:
        file - The file to create the reader for.
        lineFilter - The filter to apply to the lines.
        Returns:
        an iterator which cycles over the parsed delimited data from file.

      • getLineIterator

        public IterableReader<java.lang.String[]> getLineIterator(java.io.File file,
                                                 Filter<java.lang.String> lineFilter,
                                                 java.nio.charset.Charset charset)
        Get a reader which iterates over the delimited data in a specified file and can skip lines. Each iteration cycle returns a string array which contains the parsed data from one line of the data file. When this iteration cycle is complete (i.e. hasNext() == false), the reader (file) will be closed; however, if the iterator is not used to completion, then the reader should be closed by calling the close() method.

        A line is only included if it passes the line filter. The line filter acts on the unparsed line, which allows unparsable lines (such as comments or errant data) to be processed and skipped.

        If the input file has an unparsable line (e.g. has unmatched quotes) which passes the line filter, then an IllegalArgumentException will be thrown when that line is reached.

        The iterator returned by this method is safe for access by concurrent threads.

        Parameters:
        file - The file to create the reader for.
        lineFilter - The filter to apply to the lines.
        charset - The character set (encoding) to use when reading the file.
        Returns:
        an iterator which cycles over the parsed delimited data from file.

      • getData

        public java.lang.String[][] getData(java.io.File file)
        Get all of the delimted data from a given file. The returned array contains the parsed data as a series of arrays, each holding one line of data as would be recieved from a getNext() call to the iterator returned from getLineIterator(file).

        If the input file has an unparsable line (e.g. has unmatched quotes), then an IllegalArgumentException will be thrown.

        Parameters:
        file - The file holding the delimited data.
        Returns:
        an array holding the parsed delimited data from file.

      • getData

        public java.lang.String[][] getData(java.io.File file,
                           java.nio.charset.Charset charset)
        Get all of the delimted data from a given file. The returned array contains the parsed data as a series of arrays, each holding one line of data as would be recieved from a getNext() call to the iterator returned from getLineIterator(file).

        If the input file has an unparsable line (e.g. has unmatched quotes), then an IllegalArgumentException will be thrown.

        Parameters:
        file - The file holding the delimited data.
        charset - The character set (encoding) to use when reading the file.
        Returns:
        an array holding the parsed delimited data from file.
